newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian cotton market closed for holiday.
newsitem.headline: Indian cotton market closed for holiday.

text.p: The Bombay cotton market was closed on Monday for a national holiday. Trading resumes on Tuesday.
On Friday, cotton prices dropped on sluggish demand from yarn and textile mills and improved arrivals in the market.
In spot, Bengal-deshi lost 10 rupees to 900/940 rupees per maund (37.32 kg) and Punjab saw-ginned fell 5.0/15 rupees to 1,545/1,645 rupees per maund.

Gujarat Kalyan (medium-staple) fell 200/300 rupees to 13,500/13,800 rupees per candy (355.56 kg) and the superior variety of Gujarat Sankar-4 (long-staple) shed 400/500 rupees to 18,500/19,500 rupees per candy.
